parameters: \af[1]\N<\n[1]>Um\..\..\.. hi. Do you want to talk?
\af[2]\N<\n[2]>We're from the castle. We heard how you saved the townsfolk. We wanted to speak with you.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>We were under siege and then there was this ceremony...
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>A welcoming ceremony for \n[3], more of a celebration, for fighting off the dragon.
\af[6]\N<\n[6]>Saved the day?! Did you see the bodies outside?
\af[6]\N<\n[6]>No matter, it's too late for you two to do anything. The goblins left. These people will just have to rebuild.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>"These people", you aren't from here are you?
\af[6]\N<\n[6]>Just passing through when\.\. all this happened.
\af[6]\N<\n[6]>It was Oscar and I, we did the best we could.
\af[2]\N<\n[2]>We want to finish the job. We want to find those goblins and kill them all.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>Join us! Come into the forest and help us destroy those goblins.

parameters.name: ME - Toolbag Has Joined the Party!

parameters: \N[6] joined your party! \N[6] is a \ac[6], that means she is adept at using ranged weapons and utilizing wildland techniques.
\n<Kit>You're going to need some sugar, here's a few scoops.
Learned how to cook new recipes.
\n<Gretchen>Hello dear, would you like to rest?
\n<Gretchen>Sorry dear, you don't seem to have enough coin
\n<Gretchen>Oh my, don't you two look strong.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>We were sent from the castle to see how the town fared and bring back more people form the \V[15] guild.
\n<Gretchen>Dear, didn't you see it? The \V[15] guild is gone, the goblins destroyed it.
\af[2]\N<\n[2]>Well, in lieu of that we're here to help.
\n<Gretchen>That's mighty kind of you. We didn't think the castle would ever send help.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>We're here now. Oscar told us you might have seen were the goblins went.
\n<Gretchen>Ah, yes, I was hiding in my home before the roaring scared them all away.
\n<Gretchen>Oh my! A dragon, I thought as such but I never imagined it to be true. There was a living breathing dragon?
\af[2]\N<\n[2]>\n[3] fought it off at the castle, we were there. He was brilliant.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>Yeah well... he chased it away but I'm sure it's out there with it's goblin army destroying more villages like this.
\af[2]\N<\n[2]>Don't be silly, \n[1]. Dragons don't have goblin armies, these goblins must have been working alone.
\n<Grechen>The goblins have been harrasing this town for weeks, we just never confirmed it was them until the attack.
\af[1]\N<\n[1]>You're telling me it's just a coincidence they attacked the same time the dragon attacked?
\n<Grechen>Oh dear, I don't know. I bet the girl in the back room does though.
\n<Gretchen>She didn't give me her name but her and Oscar are the one's that saved us all. You should go talk to her.
\n<Gretchen>Oh fantastic, she came out, she really is a hero.
\n<Gretchen>She's locked herself in the back rooms. Maybe you should knock.
\N<Oscar>Phew, what are you kids doing out there? Are you two from the castle?
\N<Oscar>It's about damn time they sent some help!
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We are from the castle but we were sent here to find help. We had no idea what had happened here.
\N<Oscar>Find help? Here? Are you kidding me, the town is in shambles.
\N<Oscar>The goblins came when dusk hit, we tried to fight them off. I killed three myself, but so many are gone now.
\af[2]\n<\N[2]>Thats...\. terrible, we were in the castle when it was sieged. We only managed to escape thanks to \n[3].
\N<Oscar>Where was \n[3] when our women and children were being killed on the streets?
\af[1]\n<\N[1]>We're here to help now, where are the goblins?
\N<Oscar>They left, we think. They were burning down our buildings one by one when a roar echoed through the sky, a dragon I suspect. They they all scattered.
\N<Oscar>Grechen over there said she saw them fleeing into the forest to the North West.
\N<Oscar>Maybe you should go talk to her.

\af[6]
<\N[6]>
[1], 
[2], and I are going to go find the goblins that did this to the town and take them out. Are you in?
\N<Oscar>Hell no, I need a break. I'm not as young as I used to be. Besides, I saw how you handled yourself, \n[6], I'm sure you'll be fine.
\af[6]\n<\N[6]>I don't blame you, we'll be on our way then.
\N<Oscar>The town's ablaze, the goblins are gone. I reckon in a few hours the rain will come and put out the fire. You should at least spend the night.
\N<Oscar>I'm sure Gretchen will wave the normal fee this time.
\N<Oscar>You all are awake and must have slept like a rock. The storm I predicted yesterday rolled through, the fires are gone.
\N<Oscar>What's left of it anyways.\. Good luck out there, come find me when those goblins are finally dead.
